image.altText: Orange cones circle space around a tree

props.synopsis: Four Year Six students were injured when a branch fell from a tree during a school excursion at Government House, with one taken to hospital in a critical condition.

title.children: Schoolgirl critically injured during visit to Government House in Canberra

image.altText: a bearded man wearing a blue suit and sunglasses walks in front of the ACT Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: It took a jury three days in the ACT Supreme Court to find Aleksander Ivanovski guilty of removing a condom during an encounter with the victim in 2021.

title.children: Man found guilty of stealthing sex worker at Canberra brothel

image.altText: damaged gravestones

props.synopsis: The 180-year-old Queanbeyan Riverside Cemetery is home to its fair share of ghost stories, urban myths and legends, but locals fear for its future due to a lack of maintenance and vandalism.

title.children: Historical cemetery known for floating coffins and ghost stories in grave danger

image.altText: A school sign on the exterior of a large modern building.

props.synopsis: The Australian Taxation Office is seeking to have Brindabella Christian College wound up and declared insolvent, while the ACT government considers further action of its own.

title.children: ATO launches court action against Canberra private school owing $8 million

image.altText: Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith addresses media.

props.synopsis: ACT Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith has conceded she was first made aware of patient demand outpacing health service funding before last year's October election.

title.children: ACT health minister warned of budget woes before election

image.altText: a woman with brown hair holds a ginger cat

props.synopsis: Canberra is widely considered 'the most renter-friendly' city, but amid constant legislative changes in favour of tenants, that title may be coming at a cost to landlords, with investors leaving the ACT.

title.children: Canberra 'the most renter-friendly' city to live in — but it comes at a cost

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: Angus McKay, 32, will serve two months in prison of an 18-month jail sentence, in what is the first sentencing in Canberra following a major review of sexual assault cases.

title.children: Families clash outside Canberra court after man jailed for raping former friend

image.altText: Soccer players wearing green, black and white uniforms smile at each other during a game

props.synopsis: One year on since learning of Canberra United's financial strife, the story remains unchanged — their financial situation hasn't improved, an investor is yet to come on board, and the window for a men's bid has passed. So what can be done?

title.children: Uncertain future for Canberra's only professional football team

image.altText: an older couple holding hands with their rates bill on the dining room table

props.synopsis: Yass Valley is one of many local councils staring down a budget black hole. It blames the federal government for cutting funding but it's likely ratepayers will be the ones slugged to balance the books.

title.children: Retirees Anne and John faced a tough decision after receiving rates bill

image.altText: Aerial video of a ferry transitions to reveal 3D render of batteries within the ship

props.synopsis: Over the centuries ferries have evolved from using paddles to steam engines, to burning diesel and gas. Can the humble ferry go all electric?

title.children: 'People will be shocked': This ferry takes shipping into the future

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and glasses looks ahead

props.synopsis: Sanjeev Gupta, who emerged as the unlikely saviour of Europe's heavy industry 15 years ago and then the saviour of Whyalla, now presides over companies facing legal action, closure or sale.

title.children: Inside Sanjeev Gupta's rapidly shrinking business empire

image.altText: Charles Perkins and other members of the Freedom Ride at Bowraville, NSW, in 1965 State Library of New South Wales

props.synopsis: They were pelted with eggs and chased out of town, but these Indigenous-led protesters forged a lasting legacy in the fight against racial segregation.

title.children: Barred from pubs, pools and RSLs, these activists never gave up the fight

image.altText: People jump out of the exit of the aircraft

props.synopsis: Everyone survived the Delta Air Lines Flight 4819 crash-landing in Toronto this week, but the incident has undoubtedly raised questions about whether aviation disasters are increasing in frequency and the safety of flying in the future.

title.children: Possible lack of 'flare' during Toronto crash landing observed by experts

image.altText: A digital drawing of a yellow weatherboard house againt a blue sky and green grass with a white roof.

props.synopsis: Australian research has found a fluorescent film placed on top of "super cool" roof materials can solve glare problems while maintaining a comfortable temperature inside homes.

title.children: Red, green or orange roofs could 'super cool' your home

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: The RBA can't say so but it is entirely possible many mortgage borrowers won't have to hand over hundreds of dollars to their banks this year.

title.children: Millions of mortgage borrowers could soon be thousands of dollars better off

image.altText: Three women with serious expressions stand in a group, the centre one holding a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: The missing 29-year-old's sister says worry over her disappearance is "consuming" the family, as police expand their search area.

title.children: Family of missing Queensland woman Taylor Spies breaks silence

image.altText: A boy holds a sheep by the head while in a shearing shed

props.synopsis: Charlie Dunn is barely a teen but has already found his passion in life, and has been hard at it for the past eight years.

title.children: Meet a 13-year-old shearer who can fleece 150 sheep a day

image.altText: A heavily armed police officer stands guard in front of a taped off crime scene at night.

props.synopsis: German police have arrested a suspect in a stabbing at Berlin's Holocaust memorial that left a man seriously injured.

title.children: Police arrest suspect after stabbing at Berlin Holocaust memorial

image.altText: Farmer Michael Hastings smiles while holding a bucket of emergency silage, beside a tractor

props.synopsis: Buried under a dry mound of dirt on Michael Hastings's farm is an insurance policy he had hoped he would never need.

title.children: Farmer keeps secret drought weapon buried on property for 18 years

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man and woman stand smiling in front of a Labor banner. In the foreground are hands holding up phones taking photos

props.synopsis: SA's Premier Peter Malinauskas says the Whyalla steelworks takeover was like his marriage proposal, an elaborate plan with 'lots of moving parts'. It was a long time in the planning, but when it came, the government acted swiftly and without warning, writes Leah MacLennan.

title.children: SA Premier compares stress of Whyalla move to marriage proposal

image.altText: Salman Rushdie faces the camera with one of the lenses of his glasses blacked out.

props.synopsis: Rushdie was the key witness during seven days of testimony, describing in graphic detail his life-threatening injuries and long and painful recovery from the attack, which left him blind in one eye.

title.children: Salman Rushdie's attacker convicted of attempted murder over 2022 stabbing

image.altText: Jonathan LaPaglia looks focused during a SurvivorAU challenge, wearing a cap.

props.synopsis: In his 10 years hosting Australian Survivor, Jonathan LaPaglia — better known as JLP — has picked up a few unique habits.

title.children: Australian Survivor's host eats the same thing every day on set

image.altText: An Israeli flag is draped over the Microsoft offices

props.synopsis: US tech giants have used AI to quietly empower Israel to track and kill alleged militants quicker in Gaza and Lebanon.

title.children: How US tech giants supplied Israel with AI models

image.altText: The exterior of a modern concrete building with a sign out front reading "High Court of Australia".

props.synopsis: One of the trio of men awaiting deportation to Nauru has challenged his removal, represented by the Human Rights Law Centre.

title.children: Legal challenge launched to Australia's paid deportation to Nauru

image.altText: a fillet of pink salmon seen on rocks

props.synopsis: The Environmental Protection Authority says it has preliminary test results for the chunks that washed up on a southern Tasmanian beach last weekend, as activists share new photos of fish debris on a different beach.

title.children: New salmon debris washes ashore as EPA says it has results from 'chunks'

image.altText: A bald man.

props.synopsis: Thomas Sewell has told the Ballarat Magistrates Court a white supremacist march he is accused of leading is a constitutional issue.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader attempts to defer white supremacist march to High Court

image.altText: Steve Smith in the follow through of an agressive cricket shot down the ground

props.synopsis: Here is everything you need to know about the ICC Champions Trophy, including when Australia is playing and how to watch.

title.children: How to watch the ICC Champions Trophy and when Australia is playing

image.altText: Steve Smith looks on during an Australia versus West Indies ODI.

props.synopsis: Steve Smith says his understrength Australian squad needs to hit the ground running when it faces old foe England in Lahore.

title.children: Aussies treating Champions Trophy opener against England as a knock-out match

image.altText: A man with pink and blue hair wearing a black t-shirt sits in a wheelchair, while playing wheelchair sport.

props.synopsis: Members of both queer and disability communities face significant hurdles when it comes to accessing sport. Initiatives like the Rolling Rainbow Sport Day are helping to change that.

title.children: 'Everyone is welcome': Making sport safe for queer, disabled communities

image.altText: Two men in a room, speaking.

props.synopsis: A joint press conference between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and a key Donald Trump adviser was cancelled on Thursday, amid deteriorating relations between Kyiv and Washington.

title.children: US-Zelenskyy news conference called off, Putin ally says Trump '200pc right'

image.altText: Australian man Mohamed Rifai paraded for the media in an orange prison outfit

props.synopsis: A 27-year-old Australian man arrested and charged in Indonesia has been paraded for the media and is facing up to five years in jail after a violent brawl at a Bali beach club.

title.children: Australian man paraded for media in Bali after beach club brawl

image.altText: A group of Canadian players celebrate together on the ice after beating the US

props.synopsis: Canada has beaten the USA in a politically charged Four Nations Face-Off final in Boston, after Donald Trump reiterated his desire for Canada to become the 51st state in the build-up.

title.children: Trudeau sends pointed message as Canada beats US in heated hockey final

image.altText: Three young men inside a manhole inside a modern boat, docked at shore

props.synopsis: Three Scottish brothers are embarking on an adventure to become the first trio to row across the Pacific Ocean, nonstop and unsupported.

title.children: Brothers aiming to row from Peru to Sydney in 'bonkers' adventure

image.altText: An Indian/South Asian man with black facial hair speaks onstage wearing a light suit jacket with American flags behind him

props.synopsis: The new FBI director has been criticised for his outspoken views and contested claims, including support from some of the conspiracy theories spread by QAnon.

title.children: Having compared Trump to a king in a children's book, Patel vows to shake up the FBI
